# ADR-0001: Adopt AgentKit Forge

## Status

**Accepted**

## Date

<!-- YYYY-MM-DD -->

## Context

The **{{repoName}}** project needed a standardised way to manage documentation,
project structure, and developer tooling. Without a shared scaffold, teams
tend to diverge in layout, conventions, and documentation quality.

AgentKit Forge provides an opinionated but flexible template system that
generates and maintains project documentation, CI/CD configuration, and
coding standards from a single source of truth.

## Decision

We will adopt **AgentKit Forge v{{version}}** as the documentation and
project scaffolding tool for {{repoName}}.

All generated files will carry the standard `GENERATED` header and must not
be edited manually. Customisations are applied via the overlay system at
`agentkit/overlays/{{repoName}}`.

## Consequences

### Positive

- Consistent documentation structure across all projects.
- Single command (`pnpm -C agentkit agentkit:sync`) to regenerate files.
- Overlay system allows per-project customisation without forking templates.

### Negative

- Team members must learn the overlay mechanism to customise output.
- Generated files should not be edited directly, which may be unfamiliar.

### Neutral

- Existing documentation will be migrated into the new structure over time.
